summary: Completed comprehensive testing of 6 new HRMS modules (Assets, Expenses, Grievance/Helpdesk, Recruitment, Onboarding/Exit, Reports). Frontend fully functional with all pages accessible and properly designed. Backend has core functionality working but POST operations failing due to MongoDB ObjectId serialization issues.

critical_bugs.issue: MongoDB ObjectId serialization error causing 500 Internal Server Error
critical_bugs.impact: Blocks all create operations for new modules
critical_bugs.error_details: ValueError: [TypeError("'ObjectId' object is not iterable"), TypeError('vars() argument must have __dict__ attribute')]

flaky_endpoints.workaround: Route registration issue - routes exist in code but not accessible

passed_tests: Dashboard loads with proper stats and navigation
Assets page (/dashboard/assets) - UI fully functional with My Assets, Requests tabs
Expenses page (/dashboard/expenses) - Shows expense claims with New Expense button
Helpdesk page (/dashboard/helpdesk) - Shows ticket stats and New Ticket button
Recruitment page (/dashboard/recruitment) - Shows Open Positions and My Applications tabs
Onboarding page (/dashboard/onboarding) - Shows tasks and exit requests tabs with Submit Resignation button
Reports page (/dashboard/reports) - Shows HR analytics with Headcount, Expenses, Assets tabs
All 6 new modules accessible from sidebar navigation
UI components properly implemented with correct layouts and styling
Reports API working perfectly with proper data structure
action_item_for_main_agent: CRITICAL: Fix MongoDB ObjectId serialization issue in backend POST operations. The error 'ObjectId object is not iterable' is preventing all create operations (assets, expenses, grievances, recruitment). Also investigate 404 errors on specific routes like /my, /requests, /categories endpoints. Frontend is fully functional and ready for use.
